definition: dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: I want all you children to finish up your dinners.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你們孩子們每人把你們自己的飯菜喫光。

sentences.english: I am served my meals on my couch.
sentences.chinese: 有人給我端來飯菜，我就在沙發上進餐。

sentences.english: Taste the food before the King eats to make sure it's not poisoned.
sentences.chinese: 在國王用餐之前先嚐嘗食物，確信飯菜沒有被下毒。

sentences.english: Just based only on the food here.
B. The food tasted bad, however Aunt Kit fixed it.
sentences.chinese: 飯菜不好喫，可姬特姑媽還往裏加調味料。

sentences.english: She conjured up a whole meal in a jiffy.
sentences.chinese: 一眨眼工夫她就變出了一桌飯菜。

sentences.english: She cooked up a simple meal for me right away.
sentences.chinese: 她馬上給我做了一頓簡單的飯菜。

sentences.english: The trick is to add that food into your meals in very small amounts.
sentences.chinese: 小竅門就是往你的飯菜中加進少量的此種食物。

sentences.english: Remember the five-day rule for leftovers, too.
sentences.chinese: 對剩飯菜請同樣謹記五天原則。

sentences.english: Are you used to the food here ?
sentences.chinese: 你喫得慣這裏的飯菜嗎？

sentences.english: Providing warm meals and shelter, especially in the winter months.
sentences.chinese: 提供熱乎的飯菜和住宿地方，尤其是在冬天。

sentences.english: The meal we had at the restaurant was rather betwixt and between.
sentences.chinese: 我們在那家館子喫的那頓飯菜很一般。

sentences.english: After a user chooses a meal and submits the order, the restaurant prepares it.
sentences.chinese: 用戶選好飯菜，提交訂單後，餐廳就開始備餐了。

sentences.english: Can also taste the meal of the Yi family tradition flavor.
sentences.chinese: 還可品嚐彝家風味的飯菜。

sentences.english: I was made to help cook twenty-eight meals three times a day.
sentences.chinese: 我被迫一日三餐幫助做二十八個人的飯菜。

sentences.english: Take 1g per day preferably with meals, or as professionally prescribed.
sentences.chinese: 以最好的飯菜，每天1克，或作爲專業的規定。

definition: convenient/handy/easy/bento (a meal in a partitioned box)/lunchbox
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
